welcome.title: Salve, Custos
welcome.subtitle: Welcome to Praxia
welcome.content: Praxia is your daily companion for evidence-based parenting techniques. Based on Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT) and Incredible Years research, this app guides you through structured lessons and daily practice to build connection and reduce challenging behaviors.

steps.title: The Science
steps.content: Research shows that 10-15 minutes of daily child-directed play significantly reduces oppositional behavior. PRIDE skillsâ€”Praise, Reflect, Imitate, Describe, Enjoyâ€”are the foundation.

steps.title: The Curriculum
steps.content: Praxia guides you through four phases: Fundamentum (Foundation), Praxis (Practice), Imperium (Mastery), and Autonomia (Independence). Each phase builds on the last.

steps.title: Daily Practice
steps.content: Success comes from consistency. You'll complete timed practice sessions, track your skill usage, and monitor progress over time.

steps.title: Family Together
steps.content: Praxia supports your whole family. Each parent has their own profile, and children have a separate, age-appropriate interface with their own progress tracking.

welcome.title: Salve!
welcome.subtitle: Welcome to Praxia
welcome.content: This is your special place to learn cool skills and have fun with your family!

steps.title: How You Feel
steps.content: Every day, you can tell us how you're feeling. Just tap the bars that match your mood!

steps.title: Calm Down Steps
steps.content: When big feelings come, you have special steps to feel better. It's called Respiro!

steps.title: Earn Rewards
steps.content: The more you practice, the more cool things you unlock! Watch your Gradus bars grow!

praxis-session.title: About Praxis Sessions
praxis-session.content: A Praxis session is 10-15 minutes of special time with your child. You follow their lead in play while practicing PRIDE skills. The timer helps you stay focused, and skill prompts remind you what to practice.
tips: Let your child choose the activity
Put away all distractions
Get on their physical level
Don't teach, question, or correct during this time

respiro.title: About Respiro
respiro.content: Respiro is our adaptation of the Turtle Technique, a research-backed calming protocol. The five stepsâ€”Halt, Retreat, Breathe, Reflect, Resolveâ€”guide you or your child from escalation to calm.
tips: Practice during calm moments first
Make it a game with young children
Use it yourself to model regulation
Don't force it during peak escalation

status-check.title: About Status Checks
status-check.content: Status checks build emotional awareness. Use the gauge to rate current intensity (1-10), select words that fit, and optionally note what's happening. Over time, patterns emerge that help you intervene earlier.
tips: Do regular check-ins, not just during crisis
Notice body signals that go with each level
Use the vocabulary to expand emotional range
Review trends in your dashboard

urgentia.title: About Urgentia
urgentia.content: Urgentia is your in-the-moment support during challenging situations. It provides breathing guidance, validated scripts, and quick access to Respiro. Use it when you need help staying calm.
tips: Your calm is contagiousâ€”breathe first
Use early prompts before full escalation
After calm, always repair the connection
Log episodes for pattern analysis

episodes.title: About Episode Logging
episodes.content: Logging episodes helps identify patterns. Track intensity, triggers, what helped, and duration. Over time, you'll see which interventions work best and which situations to prepare for.
tips: Log as soon as possible after the event
Be specific about triggers
Note what worked AND what didn't
Review weekly for patterns

pcit.name: Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (PCIT)
pcit.description: PCIT is an evidence-based treatment for young children with behavioral problems. It focuses on improving the quality of the parent-child relationship and changing parent-child interaction patterns.
pcit.effectiveness: Meta-analyses show large effect sizes (d = 1.0+) for reducing disruptive behavior and improving parenting skills.
pcit.citation: Eyberg, S. M., & Funderburk, B. (2011). Parent-Child Interaction Therapy Protocol. PCIT International.

pride.name: PRIDE Skills
pride.description: PRIDE stands for Praise (labeled), Reflect, Imitate, Describe, and Enjoy. These are the core child-directed interaction skills that build the relationship foundation.
pride.effectiveness: Children of parents who master PRIDE skills show 40-60% reduction in disruptive behaviors within 8-12 weeks.
pride.citation: McNeil, C. B., & Hembree-Kigin, T. L. (2010). Parent-Child Interaction Therapy (2nd ed.). Springer.

turtleTechnique.name: Turtle Technique
turtleTechnique.description: The Turtle Technique teaches children to recognize anger, stop, go into their 'shell,' take deep breaths, and think of solutions. Praxia adapts this as Respiro.
turtleTechnique.effectiveness: Studies show significant improvements in emotional regulation and problem-solving when practiced consistently.
turtleTechnique.citation: Webster-Stratton, C. (2012). Incredible Years Parent, Teacher, and Child Training Series.

emotionCoaching.name: Emotion Coaching
emotionCoaching.description: Emotion coaching involves recognizing emotions, seeing them as opportunities for connection, helping children label feelings, and problem-solving together.
emotionCoaching.effectiveness: Children of emotion-coaching parents have better emotional regulation, social skills, and academic performance.
emotionCoaching.citation: Gottman, J. M., Katz, L. F., & Hooven, C. (1996). Parental meta-emotion philosophy and the emotional life of families.
